name: Greek Lemon-Garlic Chicken Thighs and Potatoes
author: Virginia Vohasek
summary: This simple Greek chicken and potato bake is a great family dinner. Chicken thighs are marinated in a garlic-lemon marinade and then baked in the oven.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs
directions: Combine lemon juice, chicken broth, olive oil, garlic, and oregano in a large resealable plastic bag
Add chicken, seal bag, and shake so chicken is well coated with marinade
Marinate in the refrigerator at least 2 hours or overnight
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat a 9x11-inch baking dish with cooking spray
Pour chicken and marinade into the prepared baking pan
Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 1 hour
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
